intro: Dactylorhiza × kerneriorum, commonly known as the hybrid marsh orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of greenish-yellow to brownish flowers with three sepals and three petals, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in wet, acidic environments such as bogs and marshes, often growing in shallow water or on damp soil. This species is a natural hybrid between Dactylorhiza macdougallii and Dactylorhiza viridis, showcasing genetic diversity within the genus.
